dt: {bc}a circular band for holding, connecting, hanging, pulling, packing, or sealing
{bc}a circlet usually of precious metal worn especially on the finger
often used figuratively in plural in the phrase {it}run rings around{/it} to describe surpassing an opponent decisively
{bc}an often circular space especially for exhibitions or competitions
{bc}a usually square enclosure in which a fighting contest (such as a boxing or wrestling match) takes place
{bc}a band of small objects revolving around a planet (such as Saturn) and composed of dust and icy or rocky fragments
{bc}an exclusive combination of persons for a selfish and often corrupt purpose (as to control a market)
{bc}food in the shape of a circle
{bc}an arrangement of atoms represented in formulas or models in a cyclic manner

{bc}a set of mathematical elements that is closed under two binary operations of which the first forms a commutative group with the set and the second is associative over the set and is distributive with respect to the first operation

{bc}a pair of usually rubber-covered metal {a_link|rings} suspended from a ceiling or crossbar to a height of approximately eight feet above the floor and used for hanging, swinging, and balancing feats in gymnastics
{bc}an event in gymnastics competition in which the rings are used

et: Middle English, going back to Old English {it}hring{/it} (masculine strong noun), going back to Germanic {it}*hrenga-{/it} (whence also Old Frisian {it}hring, ring{/it} "ring," Old Saxon {it}hring{/it} "chain mail," Old High German {it}ring, rinh{/it} "ring," Old Icelandic {it}hringr{/it}), going back to dialectal Indo-European {it}*kreng{sup}h{/sup}o-, *krong{sup}h{/sup}o-,{/it} whence also Old Church Slavic {it}krǫgŭ{/it} "circle, ring," Bosnian-Croatian-Serbian {it}krûg,{/it} Polish {it}krąg{/it}

The only certain attestations of this etymon are in Germanic and Slavic. As it violates an Indo-European root structure constraint on co-occurrence of a voiceless stop and a voiced aspirate stop, the etymon is presumably late or post-Indo-European, or borrowed from an unknown source.
shortdef: a circular band for holding, connecting, hanging, pulling, packing, or sealing
a circlet usually of precious metal worn especially on the finger
a circular line, figure, or object

dt: {bc}to place or form a ring around {bc}{sx|encircle||}
{bc}to throw a {a_link|ringer} over (the peg) in a game (such as horseshoes or quoits)
{bc}to form or take the shape of a ring

shortdef: to place or form a ring around : encircle

dt: {bc}to be filled with a reverberating sound {bc}{sx|resound||}
{bc}to have the sensation of being filled with a humming sound
{bc}to be filled with talk or report

dt.t: the whole land {it}rang{/it} with her fame

dt: {bc}to have a sound or character expressive of some quality
{bc}to cause to sound especially by striking
{bc}to make (a sound) by or as if by {a_link|ringing} a bell
{bc}to announce by or as if by ringing
{bc}to conclude a performance or an action
{bc}to ring frequently or constantly with incoming calls

dt.t: the telephone was {it}ringing off the hook{/it}

dt: {bc}to run through the range of possible variations
{bc}to begin a performance or an action

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}hringan{/it}; akin to Old Norse {it}hringja{/it} to ring
shortdef: to be filled with a reverberating sound : resound
to have the sensation of being filled with a humming sound

dt: {bc}a clear resonant sound made by or resembling that made by vibrating metal
{bc}a loud sound continued, repeated, or reverberated
{bc}a sound or character expressive of some particular quality

shortdef: a clear resonant sound made by or resembling that made by vibrating metal

dt: {bc}a game in which players on one team are given time to hide and are then sought out by members of the other team who try to capture them, keep them in a place of confinement, and keep them from being released by their teammates

shortdef: a game in which players on one team are given time to hide and are then sought out by members of the other team who try to capture them, keep them in a place of confinement, and keep them from being released by their teammates

dt: {bc}a children's singing game in which players dance around in a circle and at a given signal drop to the ground

shortdef: a children's singing game in which players dance around in a circle and at a given signal drop to the ground

dt: {bc}a North American gull ({it}Larus delawarensis{/it}) that as an adult is largely white with a gray mantle, dark wing tips, yellowish feet and legs, and a yellow bill with a black ring towards the tip

shortdef: a North American gull (Larus delawarensis) that as an adult is largely white with a gray mantle, dark wing tips, yellowish feet and legs, and a yellow bill with a black ring towards the tip

dt: {bc}a loose-leaf binder in which split rings attached to a back hold the perforated sheets of paper

shortdef: a loose-leaf binder in which split rings attached to a back hold the perforated sheets of paper
